page.title: 03Occupations in Woodhalls
page.content: The thinly scattered population is, almost without exception engaged in agriculture.The houses are mainly farmhouses attached to family farms Work is on the family farm and few farms employ outside workers. A couple of people are employed in activities associated with agriculture such as milling,and a few others have jobs in local manufacturing or professional work, the latter combining their jobs with part-time farming. It is an area where women have not traditionally worked outside the home or farm environment, and this is still evident today. Only a couple of women work and these do so in a part-time capacity. The farmers' wives carry out the usual household tasks occasionally helping on the farm and two of them do Bed and Breakfast trade.
